org.eclipselabs.emongo

Interface MongoIdFactory


  • public interface MongoIdFactory
    A MongoIdFactory provides the equivalent of an auto-increment primary key. Calling getNextId() will return the next value to be used as the _id in the collection. The current value is stored in the collection to maintain integrity across server restarts. There is an obvious performance penalty when using the MongoIdFactory instead of letting MongoDB generate the _id for you.
    Author:
    bhunt

    • Field Detail

      • PID

        static final java.lang.String PID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_DATABASE_FILTER

        static final java.lang.String PROP_DATABASE_FILTER
        The service property key for the MongoDB database reference filter.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_COLLECTION

        static final java.lang.String PROP_COLLECTION
        The service property key for configuring the database collection. Set the value of the collection property to the name of the database collection for which you want to use a sequential _id.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getCollectionURI

        java.lang.String getCollectionURI()
        Returns:
        the URI of the collection in the form mongodb://host[:port]/database/collection

      • getNextId

        java.lang.Long getNextId()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        the next auto-increment id value to be used as the _id value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the current value could not be stored to the database
